source.title: Plasma Source
source.description: Device which creates the plasma by (partially) ionizing a given medium.

name.title: Source Name
name.description: Name and/or type of the plasma source used in the study. Examples: kINPen, COST Jet, CCP.

properties.title: Source Properties
properties.description: Properties of the plasma source, e.g. geometry, power, current/voltage amplitude. Format is open. Example: power: 7 to 9 W; frequency: 27.12 MHz; electrodes: ring configuration, distance 5 mm, width 5 mm; capillary: inner diameter 4 mm, outer diameter 6 mm.

developedBy.title: Developed By
developedBy.description: Entity that developed the plasma source.

describedIn.title: Described In
describedIn.description: Literature(s) that describes this plasma source.

voltageFeed.title: Voltage Feed
voltageFeed.description: Specification of the voltage feed used in this plasma source.

waveForm.title: Waveform
waveForm.description: Voltage waveform (e.g, sine, square, triangle, etc).

gasFlow.title: Gas Flow [slpm]
gasFlow.description: Flow of plasma medium in standard litre per minute

certified.title: Certified?
certified.description: Certification status of the plasma source.

commercial.title: Commercially available?
commercial.description: Availability of the plasma source in the commercial market.

procedure.title: Source Procedure
procedure.description: Procedure to prepare and use the plasma source. This field should be used to described the whole procedure, including medium and target. Format is open. Example: 15 min free run before treatment.

medium.title: Plasma Medium
medium.description: Gas, mixture of gases, or other substance, which is either (partially) ionized or otherwise activated by a source device.

name.title: Medium Name
name.description: Name of the medium the plasma source is operated in. Examples: dry air, Ar, CO2, water.

properties.title: Medium Properties
properties.description: Properties of the medium, e.g. carrier gas (mixture). Format is open. Example: gas fow rate: 100 sccm; carrier gas: Ar; precursor: HMDSO; gas mixture: Ar with 10 ppm HMDSO.

stateOfMatter.title: State of Matter
stateOfMatter.description: State of matter (here gas for example).

target.title: Plasma Target
target.description: Substrate the plasma acts on, directly (target is/was in contact with a plasma) or mediated by an additional substance.

name.title: Target Name
name.description: Name of the target name the plasma source is acting on either directly or mediated by the above named medium. Examples: Si waver, distilled water, Escherichia coli.

properties.title: Target Properties
properties.description: Properties of the target. Format is open. Example: silicon wafer: 100 mm diameter, prime grade, orientation 100.

procedure.title: Target Procedure
procedure.description: Standard procedure to prepare the target (pre-treatment). Format is open. Example: E. coli prepared on glass substrate according to internal procedure XY.

diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
diagnostics.description: Measurement, modeling, or simulation method used to produce the digital resource.

name.title: Diagnostics Name
name.description: Name of the applied diagnostics and/or modelling/simulation methods. Examples: OES, SEM, PIC-MCC.

properties.title: Diagnostics Properties
properties.description: Details of the applied diagnostics. Format is open. Example: laser diode at 395 nm and 50 mW.

procedure.title: Diagnostics Procedure
procedure.description: Description of the diagnostic procedure. Format is open. Example: Voltage was measured between the contact tube of the welding torch and the workpiece.

filetype.title: Resource Filetype
filetype.description: File type of the resource. Examples: csv, pdf, png, txt.

datatype.title: Resource Datatype
datatype.description: Data type of the resource. Examples: data table, SEM image, cfu-plot, high-speed video.

range.title: Resource Range
range.description: Range in which the resource is valid. Example: wavelength range: 400-800 nm.

quality.title: Resource Quality
quality.description: Data quality score. One of: verified, published, reviewed.
